intro: My journey through education, work, volunteering, and extracurricular activities.

events.description: Assist with In-Gallery learning experiences in the Hall of Human Life, Engineering Design Workshop, and Charles River Yawkey Gallery, leading experiments for all ages.
Participating in the Girls Who Code Pathways Program to develop coding skills and connect with other young women in tech.
Draft grant proposals, plan community events, and collaborate with team members to identify strategic growth opportunities.
Work on Data Science Research focusing on algorithms affecting youth on social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook), analyzing large datasets to understand their impact.
Contribute to ongoing research projects on local, state, and federal elections in support of non-partisan political coverage.

Collaborate on engineering challenges by working on hardware projects involving soldering and Raspberry Pi, developing and optimizing embedded systems in machine code, and building prototypes using woodworking and advanced design techniques. Currently organizing a group to prepare a proposal for the American Society for Engineering Education (ASEE) conference in Charlotte, NC (June 21-24, 2026) to present student experiences in engineering project activities.

events.organization: The Academies by Harvard Student Agencies
events.description: Participate in mock consulting projects by analyzing cases, presenting team solutions, and building skills through hands-on practice and remote collaboration in financial consulting.
Tutor students in math concepts across grades K-9, adjust to students' needs, and write detailed session reports for families.

Demonstrate personal goal-setting and time management through commitment to volunteer service, personal development, physical fitness, and exploration. Awarded Congressional Award Gold Certificate in October 2025.

Research, write, and collaborate on articles focusing on town events and local news while meeting deadlines. Published over 10 articles covering community events, school productions, and local initiatives.
Attend seminars and discussions on economic issues, engage with professionals and peers, and stay informed on policy impacts through expert-led sessions.
Participated in a coding celebration event through Kode With Klossy.
Awarded the Athena Award for completing 30 hours of coding and engineering work.

Currently a sophomore with a 4.0 unweighted GPA and 5.0 weighted GPA. Active in Girls Who Code, DECA, Key Club, Ceramics Club, Model U.N., and Quiz Bowl. DECA State Qualifier (December 2024) - placed top 6 out of ~30 teams in Financial Team Decision Making.
Reviewed, edited, and wrote policy articles that address social, political, and economic issues tailored for youth audiences for clarity and accessibility.
Qualified for the Massachusetts Computer Science Olympiad (MASCO) In-Person Finals.

Completed an intensive summer program focused on foundational computer science concepts for girls. Gained hands-on experience with programming, algorithms, and problem-solving while collaborating on projects and developing technical skills in a team environment.
Participated in two squash programs that helped improve game skills and taught teamwork and discipline through competitive play.
First real experience in theater, learning about acting, stage production, and ensemble collaboration. Participated in the production of Grease, discovering the creative process of putting on a show.
Environmental camp focused on nature, ecology, and conservation. Spent time outdoors learning about ways to help the planet and developing an appreciation for environmental stewardship.
Participated in middle-school theater production of Descendants, enjoying the creative collaboration and energy of youth theater.
